2 youths crushed to death by trucks.description: GHAZIABAD: Two youths were killed after their two-wheelers were hit by heavy vehicles at two different places in Ghaziabad on Thursday morning. In the first accident, a delivery boy of an app-based food delivery company was crushed by a truck near Lajpat Nagar junction around 9am. “The accident took place when Abhishek Kasana (20) was going to Arthala Peer Dargah. A speeding truck hit his motorcycle from behind and crushed his head,” said J K Singh, the SHO of Sahibabad police station. In another accident, a 23-year-old BSc student, Mukesh Tyagi, was crushed by a truck near a junction in Duhai village when he was going to his college. Both the truck drivers have been booked under IPC sections 279 (rash driving) and 304 A (causing death by negligence). Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23. PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. Noida to clear Sector 54 landfill in a w.description: NOIDA: The Noida Authority has started shifting its waste remediation plant from Sector 54 to Mubarakpur near Sector 145. Officials said the remediation of waste at the new site will begin within a month as just about 2,000 tonnes of waste is left to be recycled at the earlier site in Sector 54. The shift was necessitated after residents approached the National Green Tribunal, protesting the waste plant near residential areas of Sector 54. The NGT had in February last year asked the Authority to look for an alternative site and Mubarakpur was chosen as it does not have human habitation around it. Most of the waste at Sector 54 has already been recycled and the 2,000 tonnes that are left will be treated in a week, officials said. Of late, the Authority has been dumping waste at Mubarakpur, where around 1 lakh tonnes of garbage has accumulated. The transfer of equipment to treat waste from Sector 54 to Mubarakpur has already begun. “Around 95,000 tonnes of waste has already been recycled in Sector 54. We are almost through with the work there and the shifting of equipment has begun,” said Alok Tandon, chief executive officer at Noida Authority. Most of the refuse derived fuel produced after remediation in Sector 54 has been sent to cement factories to be used as raw material. The leftover inert waste is being used to cover the area where waste was dumped earlier. “We also got a small portion of compost after the remediation. However, it wasn’t found to be very useful for plants. Therefore, we are just using it to fill the empty space now,” said SC Mishra, deputy general manager (public health). The Authority had employed a contractor to set up the plant for 1.5 lakh tonnes of garbage in Sector 54 and Mubarakpur. The contractor still has to remediate about 55,000 tonnes of waste. Once the contract is over, the Authority will float a tender for a new agency that will take care of the waste treatment. “Since the existing contract for remediation of 1.5 lakh tonnes of waste is getting over, we will be opening it for application again. If the process takes time, we may extend the existing contract for a brief period,” Tandon said. Residents who moved NGT described the shift as a “great victory”. “It’s a great victory for us. It shows that if residents come together, the biggest of battles can be won," said K Arunachalam, a resident of Sector 22 (one of the RWAs that approached NGT) Activists sounded an alert. “There is no human habitation very close to Mubarakpur area, but if untreated waste is used in the landfill, it can contaminate groundwater and affect our health," said Vikrant Tongad, an environmental activist. Noida: Man stops to urinate on road, 2 f.description: NOIDA: Stopping by to urinate along a roadside in Greater Noida cost a man his motorcycle Thursday as two unidentified men fled with his two-wheeler while he took the nature's call, police said. The incident took place around 2.30 pm, when Aakash, around 35, was on his way to the industrial area in Greater Noida for work and the scooter-borne duo struck his motorcycle, they said. "He was near Tilpat A chowk, under the Surajpur police station area, when he stopped to urinate on the road. He had left the key on the motorcycle when suddenly two men arrived on a red-coloured scooter and one of them got on the bike and they fled the spot before Aakash could respond," a police official told PTI. A complaint has been made by the victim and an FIR under Indian Penal Code section 379 (robbery) has been lodged at the Surajpur police station, he said. A probe is underway, the official added. Noida: Littering the roads? Flying squad.description: NOIDA: The Noida Authority has identified over 400 “garbage-vulnerable points” across the city where waste is dumped illegally along roads and drains. Warning boards are being put up at these locations and two flying squads will keep watch to ensure no waste is dumped there. These spots are different from the 263 official points and 30 collection centres from where waste is collected by the Authority. The flying squad will be checking multiple spots every day to ensure solid waste management rules are properly implemented. “The warning boards mention that anyone found littering or dumping waste will be penalised and can be imprisoned. We have already penalised a few offenders. There is a huge task ahead as we need to get all these spots cleaned,” said SC Mishra, senior manager at the Noida Authority. Officials said that left unchecked, people have now got used to throwing garbage at these points and keep coming back to using them, making it difficult to clean these in one go. The move to keep tabs on these spots comes after the UP solid waste management monitoring committee chairperson, Justice (retired) D P Singh, visited the city last week. He ordered that waste along roads was a common sight in Noida and the Authority would be penalised if these are not cleared by June 30. “The committee had observed that there were garbage piles along roads across the city. They said that it impacted overall public health. They gave two major orders. One was to clean these spots by June 30 and the other was to ensure segregation of waste at source,” said an official from Noida Authority. The Authority had earlier asked all RWAs, malls, hospitals, hotels and industries to start segregation at source. It had also ordered that after June 30, only dry segregated waste will be picked up from residential areas. The RWAs are expected to use composting machines to manage wet waste internally. While residents claimed that it was difficult to start segregation immediately, officials said they were hopeful of meeting the deadline. “We have been speaking to RWAs regarding waste segregation and I have personally met members of over 20 RWAs. I hope that most people will cooperate with us, as we are going to stop collecting wet waste entirely,” said Alok Tandon, chief executive officer, Noida Authority. Car showrooms penalised for littering dr.description: NOIDA: The Noida Authority has penalised 11 car dealerships and showrooms for littering and discharging their untreated waste directly into the drain. About Rs 15 lakh penalty has been imposed and will be doubled if not paid in 24 hours, according to the CEO’s order. “This is the largest penalty amount we have imposed in a single day. When we inspected the showrooms of these big car companies, we found several violations of the NGT orders. Their sewer line was choked, untreated waste was being dumped in drains and there was rampant use of plastic packaging,” said a Noida Authority official. The largest penalty amount of Rs 5 lakh has been imposed on an Indian car manufacturer. Two others have been fined with Rs 3.5 lakh each. The move comes after UP solid waste management monitoring committee chairperson, justice (retired) D P Singh, visited the city last week. He said that the Noida Authority will be penalised if the waste along the roads is not cleared by June 30. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Yoga Day.description: The world marks the fifth edition of International Day of Yoga on June 21, 2019. Prime Minister Narendra Modi hosted the main event in Ranchi and performed yoga along with 18,000 people. It was on September 27, 2014 that PM Modi proposed a dedicated day for Yoga to the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA). In 2015, the first International Day of Yoga was observed. Here's a look at different yoga styles and its growing popularity worldwide. Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

No safety gear, worker falls off 1st flo.description: GREATER NOIDA: A 23-year-old construction worker died after he slipped from the first-floor balcony of an under-construction building of a private school in Sector 126 where he was fitting glass panes to windows. The victim was identified as Shadab, a resident of Bhangel village in Noida. He was unmarried and lived in a rented accommodation. The accident occurred around 11am, when Shadab was working on the first-floor of the under construction building. Mustakeem, brother of the deceased labourer who was with him at the construction site, said they had been employed by the contractor of the project for the past one month. “I had gone out for some work but he was fitting glasses to windows on the first floor. No sooner did I hear about the accident, I ran back to the construction site and rushed my brother to Kailash Hospital along with a few others. He was declared dead at the hospital,” said Mustakeem. He said the contractor who had hired them had not given them any safety gear. “We had been employed by a contractor named Mukesh Kumar a month ago. None of us were given any helmet or safety belt, but were made to work at heights,” Mustakeem added. Bhuvneesh Kumar, the station house officer of Expressway police station, said no complaint had been filed in the case as yet. “We were told that the two parties had reached a compromise outside the police station. Nobody has filed a complaint,” said Kumar. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Seven held in Noida farmhouse for raping.description: NOIDA: Seven persons have been arrested for allegedly raping three Delhi-based women at a farmhouse in Noida’s Sector 135 area, close to the venue of a pool party from where 192 youngsters were arrested last month. The women, who police said were sex workers, had been brought to Noida by two of the accused, but they were later joined by seven others, who forced themselves on to the women against their wish. Seven of the men were arrested from HPS farmhouse area in Chhaprauli village. Police said the farmhouse belongs to an official in Delhi’s transport department, Panchpal Singh. One of the arrested men, Lovkesh Yadav, works as a security guard at the farmhouse, which was sealed by the police under Section 102 of the CrPC. The women lodged a complaint at Expressway police station on Wednesday morning, alleging that around 11.30 pm on Tuesday, they were standing near Lajpat Nagar metro station when two men arrived in a cab — a white Swift Dzire (DL1ZC0576). “The women told police that they reached an agreement for Rs 9,000,” Gautam Budh Nagar SSP Vaibhav Krishna said. The men apparently told the women they would take them to Sector 18 and handed over an advance of Rs 3,600, but instead took them to the HPS farmhouse in Sector 135. There, seven people joined them, which was not part of the deal, police said. “Seeing nine men, the women raised objection and asked the men to leave them back to Delhi. However, the accused men forcibly had sex with them,” the SSP said.After much pleading, one of the accused left the women on Pusta road on a bike, after which they approached the cops. Based o the complaint, an FIR was lodged against the accused men under IPC sections 376(d) and 323. A team from the Expressway police station raided the farmhouse and arrested seven of the accused — Akhilesh Yadav, Lovkesh Yadav, Bhola Yadav, Anjan Yadav, Rajesh Yadav, Satish Pal and Rajkumar Maurya. AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani. Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. \nWinners of Miss India North 2018 put u.description: The red carpet was ready and so was the ramp, which was set up in the sprawling sports complex of Bennett University, Greater Noida, to welcome the eight winners of fbb Colors Femina Miss India North 2018. In a special show organised for the students of Bennett University, the eight winners not just interacted with the students, but also shared a few tips on how to chase one's dreams while pursuing their academic goals. "Always concentrate on giving your best to achieve what you want," said fbb Colors Femina Miss India Uttar Pradesh 2018 Himanshi, when she was asked how tough it was to establish a foothold in the glamour world by one of the students during the Q&A round between the state finalists and students. Replying to a question on how to pursue one's passion while studying, Anna Kler, fbb Colors Femina Miss India Punjab 2018, said, "If you really follow your heart and believe that this is meant for you, you should just go for it and give it your best. You would be able to achieve what you want."  fbb Colors Femina Miss India Delhi 2018 Gayatri Bhardwaj with Aditi Bose Saurabh Tantia and Tanvi Mishra were chosen as the Mr and Miss Rampwalk of Bennett University by eight state winners When students joined the beauty queens on the rampThe event was hosted by emcee Bhavdeep Romana and Viren Tak, Oppo Times Fresh Face 2017 first runner-up. As students cheered for the eight finalists who will head to Mumbai for the grand finale of fbb Colors Femina Miss India 2018, the beauty queens gave their introduction and walked the ramp dressed in shimmering gowns designed by fashion designer Bhawna Rao. Gayatri Bhardwaj, fbb Colors Femina Miss India Delhi 2018, was chosen as Bennett University Miss Popular by the students. "I am absolutely thrilled to be chosen as Miss Popular here," said Gayatri, who also selected five lucky draw winners and gifted them a year's subscription of gaana.com. Students too walked the ramp where Tanvi Mishra and Saurabh Tantia were chosen as Bennett University Miss and Mr Rampwalk.  fbb Colors Femina Miss India Delhi 2018 Gayatri Bhardwaj was also voted as Bennett University Miss Popular by the students  Students cheered for the eight state winners as well as their friends who walked the ramp 'I love the energy and crowd here, and enjoyed meeting the students'The finalists were quite impressed with the swanky campus of Bennett University, which is a fun place to study at where celebrities and noted personalities from all walks of life visit regularly to interact with the students. "I love the energy and crowd here. I really enjoyed meeting and chatting with the students," said fbb Colors Femina Miss India Haryana 2018 Meenakshi Chaudhary. A day spent at Bennett University made fbb Colors Femina Miss India Jammu & Kashmir 2018 Malika Kapoor nostalgic. "It took us back to our college days and it was very nice to be here. It is lovely to see the infrastructure of the university," she said. Villagers stall demolition drive in Baro.description: NOIDA: Hundreds of villagers staged a sit-in demonstration on Tuesday after a Noida Authority team reached Barola village for an anti-encroachment drive. Previously, the Authority had attempted to get the site cleared at least three times but their efforts remained unsuccessful owing to the protests. The Noida Authority said a few houses and a marble market have illegally come up on the green belt. “There are several small patches of land that are part of the Noida Authority’s green belt and park area along the DSC road in Barola. These have been illegally encroached upon by the marble market. It has to be cleared sooner or later,” said MP Singh, officer on special duty, Noida Authority. After the villagers gathered, extra police force and the city magistrate was called in to settle the matter. The Noida Authority team returned on Tuesday without taking any action. The officials said paperwork is being checked. Residents of Barola village, who have been protesting the drive since Sunday, said the land was acquired and later given back to them. However, the Noida Authority still comes back for demolition after misdirecting the National Green Tribunal, they alleged. “The Authority had acquired our land in 1976 but it was later notified in our names following years of protest. Most people had not taken any compensation for their previously acquired land. However, in 2017, the authority and residents of Sector 48 approached the NGT stating that the marble market is built over the green belt,” said Shubhash Chauhan from Barola . After the NGT ordered the demolition, the villagers said the Authority had deliberately not mentioned that the land was given back to the villagers. “The NGT had asked the Noida Authority to handle the matter. They have not responded to our queries regarding the matter. There are over 200 families living here and we cannot just let them demolish our homes and take away our land illegally,” said Prem Singh Bhati, another Barola resident. Noida to use altered nozzles in private.description: NOIDA: In an experiment aimed at water conservation, the Noida Authority is planning to install altered nozzles that reduce usage by up to 98% at the Sector 14 A residences of senior officials. The nozzles cost between Rs 250 and Rs 400. The Authority has said it will begin the experiment with 24 houses before extending it to public areas or residential sectors. Officials said that this is a test project to check feasibility. “This is just a pilot (project). It is initially being tested if the water flow and the technique are feasible or not. It will soon be installed in offices, public toilets and other areas as well,” said Rajeev Tyagi, general manager, Noida Authority. According to private companies that are offering this nozzle, it reduces the size of the water droplets so that is just enough for washing hands, vegetables and fruits. This can reduce water usage by up to 95%, the firms say. However, if greater water flow is required, the nozzle can be turned accordingly for more force. The size of the water droplets, however, remains small, and usage with this is reduced by up to 80%. “It is a one-time investment that can be a huge leap towards water conservation. People can start using these at home as well. It is a technique already being used in many hotels and was suggested by a resident over WhatsApp,” said Alok Tandon, chief executive officer, Noida Authority. The nozzle requires cleaning once every 45 days. Several designs of altered nozzles and tap filters are available online through e-commerce websites. Third bridge on Shahdara drain may open.description: GREATER NOIDA: Widening of the third bridge over the Shahdara drain between Sector 14A and Sector 15 roundabout is on the verge of completion and it is likely to open next week. The new bridge will come as a relief for thousands of commuters who travel between Delhi and Noida. Officials said the widening work had been done by the Delhi Flood Control Board at a cost of Rs 5.4 crore. Earlier, the road had two lanes, which has been widened to four. Work on the project had started eight months ago. “We had been receiving a number of complaints from commuters as well as traffic police about the bottleneck on the road leading to Sector 15 roundabout from Noida gate. Earlier, this traffic jam would trail back to Sector 14 A, which caused a lot of problems to commuters. We are hopeful that with the construction of this 72-metre patch, the issue will be resolved,” said Vijay Rawal, project engineer at the Noida Authority. He added that the bridge would be thrown open next week. Another boost to Noida-Delhi traffic was the opening of a roundabout before the Mahamaya flyover on Thursday. Constructed at a cost of about Rs 3 crore, work on the new roundabout had started in January. Abdul Kadir, site engineer of the project, told TOI that the cut had become prone to accidents because of traffic merging from three directions. “Traffic coming from Greater Noida, Amity University and Kalindi Kunj were merging at this point while those who needed to go towards HCL would get puzzled,” said Kadir, adding that with the construction of this new roundabout, the choke point would be decongested. Officials said the first bridge over the Shahdara drain was constructed near Sector 18 in 2017, while the second one was the Kalindi Kunj bridge that was inaugurated by chief minister Yogi Adityanath last year. The site engineer said construction work on the roundabout had not been fully completed yet as the Authority is also planning to construct two tripods at the curves to avoid congestion. “To fully implement the diversion plan, we will construct two tripods on the opposite curves of the roundabout — one on the expressway side and the other one on the Kalindi Kunj side. This will make the passage of the vehicles easier,” said Kadir. He added that they had currently placed a few barriers to mark the boundaries of the tripod, and construction would begin after a 10-day trial. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Gang that targeted upscale homes busted.description: GHAZIABAD: A gang that committed thefts in upscale residential areas of Delhi-NCR has been busted. Police said the accused were involved in a burglary that took place in Bhopura area of Ghaziabad last month. At that time, the gang had kept an elderly couple hostage at gunpoint and robbed them of jewellery and cash. According to the police, the accused have been identified as Salim alias Papi, Mohammad Salim, both from Loni, Sohail from Baghpat and Umesh, a resident of Badaun.  “They were arrested on Wednesday morning from Sahibabad area of Ghaziabad,” a police officer said. Shlok Kumar, superintendent of police (city) told TOI that on June 14, the accused broke into the house of the elderly couple. “The accused held them hostage at gunpoint and robbed the house. They fled with jewellery and other valuables,” he added. “The police recovered stolen jewellery, two motorcycles, two illegal pistols, some live cartridges and four sharp knives from their possession,” he stated. Kumar further said that the gang of robbers had been active in the region for the past three months in the area and all the accused were sent to jail after being produced in the court on Wednesday. UP-Rera calls out to actual buyers of sc.description: GREATER NOIDA: To get a clarity on the actual ownership of flats and weed out ghost buyers or multiple allottees in Unnati Fortune’s deregistered housing project Aranya in Sector 119, the Uttar Pradesh Rera Estate Regulatory Authority (UP-Rera) has decided to float a website to invite all actual investors to register and declare ownership. The Aranya project was probably the first housing project in India to be deregistered under the new real estate law and taken over for completion by the regulatory authority in May. The project, which began in 2007, is valued over Rs 1,500 crore, and the total number of investors is around 1,400. According to UP-Rera member Balwinder Kumar, the step will help the regulatory authority to know exactly how many genuine buyers are invested in the project, so that a correct estimate can be drawn of the amount of money paid up to the builder and how much the investors still owe towards the completion of their flats. “During preliminary investigation, we found multiple allocation of single flats. We have also found multiple flats — 10 or 15 in a bunch booked under a single name. So obviously we are finding it difficult to get a true picture of the list of buyers. But a fresh registration of all buyers of the project would help us identify them,” Kumar told TOI. Moreover, the regulator is in the process of getting a co-builder on board for the completion of the pending flats. “We have also asked a builder, chosen by the buyers to present their completion plan to UP-Rera on Wednesday. If we are not convinced, we may ask Noida Authority to select a builder for the same,” he added. The UP-Rera had earlier asked the state government to constitute a special investigation team to look into the alleged misappropriation of Rs 147 crore by Unnati. The figure came to fore after a forensic audit by Curry & Brown. Moreover, an inspection team of Noida Authority earlier found that out of eight towers, only four are ready for completion and in four towers, major construction work is still pending. While Aranya phases 1 and 2 apartment buyers have completely paid up their money and the phases 3, 4 and 5 buyers have so far only paid up about 20% of the cost to the builder. UP-Rera officers earlier confirmed that the builder had left the country. The completion of the project has been initiated by UP-Rera by invoking Section 7 of the Rera Act, which makes provision for UP-Rera to step in and facilitate completion of abandoned projects. Woman (84) dies at home, stench leads to.description: NOIDA: The body of an 84-year-old woman was found in a badly decomposed state at her Sector 37 house on Monday morning. Anita Khanna, whose husband had died a few years ago, was living alone without her family, police said. She was a heart patient. Khanna is suspected to have expired nearly three days ago, but her body was found only when an employee working with a meter reading company informed police that the house was emitting foul smell. Amit Kumar, Sector 37 chowki in-charge said that a police response vehicle was sent to the spot around 11am on Monday. “Her elder son is working in Dubai as a trader while her younger son is working in Bengaluru. Her daughter-in-law, who stays with her parents in Sector 29, was informed about the incident. Her elder son later came from Dubai. They refused to get a post-mortem done,” Kumar said. In the same sector, retired major general Sher Singh Rathore, also 84, died at his home late Tuesday night. His body was retrieved on Wednesday morning. Rathore, who was suffering from high blood pressure and high sugar levels, told his attendant Ankit on Tuesday night that he felt uneasy. When Ankit checked his room later, he found that Rathore was not moving and informed police, said Sector 39 SHO Rajesh Sharma. Rathore is survived by three daughters, all based in the United States. While police said that Ankit was a full-time attendant, neighbours said he used to work part-time. The incidents come days after badly decomposed bodies of a middle-aged couple, Shashi (55) and Renu (52), were recovered from a lawyer’s flat in Sector 99’s Supreme Tower in May. The two were suspected to have committed suicide due to financial woes. In October last year, 52-year-old journalist Babita Basu’s body was recovered three weeks after her death in the same society. In May last year, the Gautam Budh Nagar police had planned a drive to reach out to senior citizens living alone in Noida to ensure their safety. The drive, however, never really took off. Speaking to TOI, circle officer I, Dr Kaustubh, said that they will speak to resident welfare associations about elderly citizens who are living alone without their families and try to interact with them. 13km DND corridor to transport live hear.description: NOIDA: A ‘live’ heart was transported from one private hospital in Noida to another in Delhi through a green corridor that was created on Sunday night, officials said on Monday. The city traffic police created a 13-kilometre-long green corridor via the DND Flyway and the organ was transported in eight minutes and thirty seconds. Superintendent of police (traffic) Anil Jha said that around 6 pm on Sunday, Noida’s Fortis Hospital in Sector 62 informed police that a heart was to be transported to Delhi’s Max hospital. He said that doctors were of the view thatthe receiver of the organ should get it as soon as possible. Officer Jha said that after the information was received, they started preparing traffic control and personnel were deployed on the stretch between Sector 62 and DND Flyway. The heart left the hospital around 9.38pm and reached the DND Flyway. After this, the Delhi traffic police took over and transported the vital organ safely to the hospital in Saket. Traffic officers said that the heart was successfully transplanted to the patient at the Delhi hospital. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Major fire in Kalindi Kunj, Delhi Metro'.description: NEW DELHI: A major fire broke out at the furniture market near Kalindi Kunj metro station on Friday morning. Officials said 15 fire tenders were pressed into service and the blaze has been doused. No casualties were reported in the incident. Metro services between Kalindi Kunj and Botanical Garden had to be stopped due to the fire, but they have resumed now. Magenta Line Update Train movement has been stopped temporarily between Jasola Vihar Shaheen Bagh and Kalindi Kunj… https://t.co/f7xylpH7oB— Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (@OfficialDMRC) 1561077443000Assistant divisional officer, Delhi Fire Service, Mehmood said, "The SOS came at 5.25am regarding the fire in the furniture market. We have managed to douse the fire now. Pillar number 205 and 206 have been damaged due to the fire. A team of Delhi Metro officials is reviewing the situation." Officials said the fire had spread rapidly since a large amount of wooden and plastic material were stored in the area. Some of the houses in the area had to be evacuated by the fire department and the police to prevent any mishap. India Pakistan news.description: NEW DELHI/ISLAMABAD: India dismissed on Thursday as "fake news" the suggestion in Pak media that it was looking to resume talks with the hostile neighbour and asserted that there was no dilution of its position that Islamabad needed to take verifiable and irreversible action against terrorism for the dialogue to resume. Responding to Pakistan PM Imran Khan's congratulatory letter after he assumed office for the second time, PM Narendra Modi wrote back on June 12 expressing India's desire to have normal and cooperative relations with all its neighbours, including Pakistan, while stressing that "for this, it is important to build an environment of trust, free of terror, violence and hostility". Foreign minister S Jaishankar also wrote to his Pakistani counterpart S M Qureshi, again only in response to the latter's congratulatory letter, emphasising the need for an atmosphere "free from the shadow of terror and violence". The emphasis on the need for Pakistan to rein in terror as a pre-condition for re-engagement was in keeping with the stand which saw Modi refrain from engaging with Imran Khan at the just-concluded SCO summit in Kyrgyzstan. Yet, the Pakistani media chose to interpret the contents of the letters of Modi and Jaishankar as reflecting India's desire to re-engage. The foreign ministry in Delhi quickly scotched the suggestion. "There was complete distortion and an attempt to peddle fake news (in the way it was reported). The letters only reiterated India's old position that it wants normal and cooperative relations with all countries in South Asia and that it was important to create an environment free of terror and violence for it. There was no mention of any sort of dialogue with Pakistan," said MEA spokesperson Raveesh Kumar, adding that India will not be fooled by any cosmetic action against terror by Islamabad. Emphasising that both the letters were written in as per the "established diplomatic practice", Kumar said: "In their messages, they have highlighted that India seeks normal and cooperative relations with all neighbours, including Pakistan." In his letter, Modi had said that India remained committed to operationalising early an "all-year-round" Kartarpur corridor. Touching upon it, Kumar said India had already held three technical-level discussions with Pakistan and was currently awaiting clarification from Islamabad over a few issues it had raised. Puzzlingly, later in the evening, Pakistan's foreign ministry, which had kept quiet through the day, also sought to play down the speculation about the import of the letters. While responding to a question, the spokesperson said, "It was an established practice for the leadership to congratulate new office holders and for them to respond." "Pakistan's position on the way forward in relations with India was clear and well-known and did not require repetition," said the spokesperson, adding that the "vision of peace, progress and prosperity of South Asia could be advanced by peacefully resolving all outstanding disputes, including Jammu & Kashmir, and moving away from dynamic of confrontation to cooperation". Earlier in the day, sources in the Pakistan foreign office had said that Modi and Jaishankar had responded positively to recent letters from their Pakistani counterparts by conveying New Delhi's desire to engage with all countries, including Pakistan, for elimination of terrorism and prosperity of the region. "India has always prioritised peace and human development, and sought to maintain cordial relations with all regional powers," Modi and Jaishankar maintained, according to FO sources. Both leaders, according to FO sources, called for special attention on elimination of terrorism in the region and said the issue must be a core focus in all future talks. They have also appreciated sentiments from Pakistan in their letters, the FO sources added. Modi's letter was in response to a congratulatory letter from Khan in which he had underscored Pakistan's vision of working for "durable peace and stability in South Asia with peaceful resolution of all outstanding disputes, including J&K". Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi. Stop power cuts before hiking tariffs: N.description: NOIDA: Residents of Noida decried the proposal for a 20% hike in power tariff, calling it unjustified in the wake of recurrent and long power cuts in the city during peak summer. The protests came on a day the Gautam Budh Nagar district was felicitated by the UP government for collecting around Rs 14.8 crore in power revenue between October last year and this March, the highest in the state during the period. The district was followed by Ferozabad at Rs 9.6 crore and Mainpuri, which collected Rs 9.3 crore in the same period. GB Nagar’s overall collection of power revenue for the financial year 2018-19 was also at an all-time high of Rs 103 crore, in comparison to Rs 64 crore collected in 2017-18. District magistrate BN Singh was felicitated with a gold certificate by chief secretary Anup Chandra Pandey for the highest revenue collection. “Collection of revenue from power has been maximum at Rs 103 crore for the financial year 2018-19, as against Rs 64 crore in 2017-18. This award is in recognition of such steep collection,” said Singh, the district magistrate. Residents, however, protested the plan to increase tariff and called for an upgrade in power infrastructure. “We welcome the felicitation of the district for collecting the highest revenue. But we are completely opposed to the proposed 20% hike in power tariff for the simple reason that we have been facing long outages of late in Noida and Greater Noida. There has been lack of upgraded infrastructure and accountability on the part of the power department in the district. Despite paying hefty bills, we are facing 4-8 hours of power cuts every day. How can a tariff hike be justified in a situation where the power department is unable to provide regular supply?” asked NP Singh, president of the Federation of Noida Residents Welfare Associations (FONRWA). Apart from the 20% increase in power tariff across slabs, the UP Power Corporation Limited (UPPCL) has also suggested a hike in the fixed charge from Rs 90 per KW to Rs 110. If implemented, this will lead to a steep increase in power bills — a monthly bill of, say, Rs 3,000 will rise to around Rs 4,000. In the tariff proposal submitted to UP Electricity Regulatory Commission, UPPCL has recommended the highest increase of 26% in the lowest slab of 0-150 units, raising it from Rs 4.90 per unit to Rs 6.20. The tariff for the 151-300 units slab is proposed to be hiked from Rs 5.40 to Rs 6.50 per unit. According to the RWA federation president, the hike is all the more unjustified in a district that pays the highest revenue and steep electricity bills. “Noida is a ‘no power cut zone’, which is required for promotion of industry. It’s also an area which provides the maximum revenue. Then, why should it be subjected to a tariff hike? We oppose the proposal and will take up the matter with chief minister Yogi Adityanath. We will approach Prime Minister Narendra Modi, if needed,” said NP Singh. Greater Noida resident Alok Kumar suggested that the power department should instead focus on laying underground cables, upgrading old transformers, replacing rusting poles, panel boxes and increasing load capacities of substations. “We congratulate the district magistrate for the felicitation in revenue collection, but strongly oppose the hike in tariff,” said Kumar. District magistrate Singh maintained that the hike was in the proposal stage. “The tariff hike proposal pertains to the power department. Residents should raise their concerns regarding tariff etc with them or the Uttar Pradesh Electricity Regulatory Committee. It does not fall under my jurisdiction,” said Singh, adding that he was only authorised for revenue collection. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta Matka 2018.description: AGRA: Shyam Vohra, known as 'satta king' of the Taj city, was denied bail by district court of Agra. Vohra, who was arrested by the Agra police in July for his alleged involvement in betting on FIFA World Cup matches. Earlier, in April, Vohra was arrested by the Nodia STF from Greater Noida for placing bets on IPL matches, but he was granted bail. After Vohra’s arrest, Agra police booked him and his known associates including his son Vatsal, wife Rakhi, nephew Prateek, brother-in-law Kaushal and others for their alleged involvement in betting. On Monday, judge Anil Kumar Pundhir rejected Vohra’s bail plea, who was charged for attempt to murder, as he allegedly opened fire on policemen. Further, Vohra was charged for running illegal gambling racket, criminal conspiracy and obstructing policemen from executing their duties. Police are yet to arrest the relatives and associates of Vohra. Several years back, Vohra had gain notoriety for betting on cricket matches. In April, during IPL matches, the gambling racket run by Vohra had deposited Rs 62 lakh in 10 banks, after which police approached banks to freeze the amount. Even during the FIFA World Cup, Vohra collected huge amount of cash through betting. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Noida plans flyover or underpass to uncl.description: NOIDA: The Noida Authority has earmarked Rs 90 crore to unclog the perennially congested Parthala Chowk, which falls at the cusp of Vikas Marg and Faridabad-Noida-Ghaziabad (FNG) Expressway. A major survey is currently on to determine whether an underpass or a flyover can be constructed to ease traffic at the roundabout, officials said. The move comes after previous experiments failed to reduce congestion at the busy intersection and in the wake of the Greater Noida Authority approving the extension of the Aqua Line with a proposed station in Sector 123 at the Parthala Chowk. The metro extension project is expected to kick off later this year. “Parthala roundabout is a key junction in Noida. We are currently carrying out the survey. And once we get the report, we will take a call on whether an underpass or a flyover would be able to provide smooth connectivity from Ghaziabad to Noida and Greater Noida via the FNG corridor,” KK Aggarwal, Authority’s general manager, told TOI. “The decongestion project at the junction entails an investment of Rs 90 crore. We will spend the money once we finalise a structure on the basis of the feasibility survey report,” he added. Experts also agree. Naveen Sharma of Medulla Soft Technologies that submitted a traffic feasibility report on the area to Noida Authority in March this year, said that while about 7,000 to 8,000 vehicles ply every hour in the area during day time, the number increases to about 18,000 during peak hours. “We had recommended reducing the circumference of the roundabout and other minor alterations. But in the long run, a graded separation by way of a flyover or an underpass is the eventual option for the intersection, especially since metro connectivity is planned in the area,” he added. Residents of highrise apartments in the vicinity of Parthala Chowk say unclogging the roundabout is the need of the hour. “Congestion at the busy intersection is increasing with each passing day. The Noida Authority must take a concrete step to ease traffic snarls at the roundabout once and for all,” said Sanjeev Dixit, a resident of Sector 121. Currently, the Parthala Chowk connects many areas and is a main connecting point for Noida, Greater Noida and Ghaziabad. While it has traffic coming from Ghaziabad in the north side of the roundabout, its east side has the busy Kisan Chowk. The south of the roundabout caters to Surajpur area of Greater Noida, including the collectorate and the police headquarters, and its west side has traffic coming from Sector 71 and beyond, including the populated 7x sectors as well as the industrial sectors of 62 and 63. Mamata Banerjee.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Projecting TDP supremo and AP chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu as a “national leader of importance” and keeping the debate on the alternate front prospects in the ensuing elections alive, West Bengal chief minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee appealed to people of AP to elect TDP again to keep the duo of Narendra Modi and Amit Shah away from power. “Who is Modi to ask about our Prime Minister candidate? We will decide who to elect our leader as there will be alternative for Modi,” she pointed out. Mamata said Naidu has done a lot for development of Andhra Pradesh. “It’s a necessity for AP people to give the power to Naidu again as he will play a key role in national politics and show a path of development to the entire country,” she added. Addressing a public meeting convened by TDP on Sunday, Mamata said Naidu is the leader to take the country forward. “Like he has done in Andhra Pradesh, Naidu can do a lot in Delhi,” she said. Coming down heavily on Modi, Mamata appealed the gathering to save the country and remove Modi (desh ko bachana hai to Modi ko hatao). “Modi claimed to be chaiwala after 2014 elections. Now he says he is chowkidar,” she added. “But chowkidar for whom? For those who looted the country. Modi had claimed that demonitisation would mitigate terrorism and stop black money, but ironically the number of terrorist attacks was the highest in the past two years. Under Modi’s regime, more number of farmers committed suicide and unemployment increased.” She added that Modi failed to explain the Pulawama incident and the Rafale deal and spurned the demand for an all-party meeting on the issues. “The nation does not want leaders like Narendra Modi and Amit Shah,” she asserted, and challenged Modi for an open debate on a national channel of his choice to discuss issues facing the country. BJP List 2019 Maharashtra.description: AURANGABAD/KOLHAPUR: Sitting MPs Sunil Gaikwad (Latur) and Dilip Gandhi (Ahmednagar) were denied tickets for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections in the BJP’s first national list of candidates announced on Thursday. The list included 16 names from Maharashtra. While speculations were rife that the party would not retain Gaikwad owing to his differences with some senior BJP leaders, what came as a surprise was the ticket going to Sudhakar Shrungare, a member of the Latur zilla parishad. However, Shrungare, who is in the construction business, was the popular choice of local BJP workers. Gaikwad had won the 2014 election by a majority of over 2.5 lakh votes. Considered to be close to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, he was reportedly at loggerheads with Latur district guardian minister Sambhaji Patil-Nilangekar. The nomination of Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, from Ahmednagar instead of Gandhi was a foregone conclusion ever since he joined the party last week. Sujay, a neurosurgeon by profession, will be making his entry into politics with this nomination. His late grandfather, Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, was long associated with the Congress. | Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in MaharashtraAmong other prominent leaders from Maharashtra in the first list of candidates are Union minister Nitin Gadkari from his hometown Nagpur, state BJP chief Raosaheb Danve from Jalna, Union MoS Hansraj Ahir from Chandrapur and Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre from Dhule. Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter, Pritam, who was elected to Parliament with a record majority after her father’s death, has been renominated from Beed. Sitting MP from Sangli Sanjay Patil has also been renominated, putting an end to speculation over any change in constituency. Patil’s candidature was opposed by a section of BJP leaders in Sangli. However, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis is understood to have called a meeting of local party leaders and resolved the differences. The party has also given tickets to Heena Gavit from Nandurbar, Raksha Khadse from Raver, Poonam Mahajan from Mumbai North Central, Kapil Patil from Bhiwandi, Sanjay Dhotre from Akola, Ramdas Tadas from Wardha, Ashok Nete from Gadchiroli and Gopal Shetty from Mumbai North. Delhi cop\u2019s boxer son held with her.description: GREATER NOIDA: A 24-year-old state-level boxer from Haryana, son of a Delhi Police sub-inspector, and two others have been arrested in Greater Noida for allegedly peddling drugs. Police said the trio was caught red-handed near a railway crossing in Badalpur early on Thursday morning while carrying 745gm of heroin worth Rs 80 lakh on a bike. With their arrests, police claimed to have blown the lid off an inter-state banned substance supply module that used to get consignments from Bihar and sell the same in UP and Haryana. The arrests of the three — identified as boxer Himanshu Balbariya, a resident of Rewari district in Haryana, water purifier salesman Vikas (35), originally from Madhepura district in Bihar, and Dharmraj (30), a native of Badaun district in Uttar Pradesh — came on a tip-off. “We received information on Wednesday night that the three youths would be passing through Badalpur on a bike. We immediately formed a team and set up a checkpost near the Sadullapur railway crossing,” said Vinit Jaiswal, SP (rural). As soon as the police team spotted spotted the trio approaching the checkpost around 3am on Thursday, the cops signalled them to stop. “Realising they were about to be caught, the accused tried to speed away. However, our men nabbed them after a brief chase, and recovered the heroin,” Jaiswal added. During interrogation, Himanshu told cops that he was actually taking a lift from Vikas and Dharmraj who had come to Greater Noida to hand him over the consignment. “Himanshu took to peddling drugs a few years ago to splurge on friends and support his lifestyle. He came in contact with Vikas and Dharamraj, and then the trio started sourcing banned substances from Vashishth Kumar, a resident of Munger district in Bihar, who also happens to be a cousin of Vikas,” the SP (rural) said. “Himanshu claimed to be a state-level boxer from Haryana, and is currently pursuing a law course at Kurukshetra University. He has confessed to peddling weed a number of times. But he told us this was the first time that he trafficked heroin,” he said. Cops said Himanshu’s father Ram Singh Balbariya, a Delhi Police officer, had been suspended briefly on corruption charges in the past. The three have been booked under sections 8/21 of the Narcotic Drugs and Psycotropic Substances Act. “They were produced in a city court and sent to judicial custody,” Jaiswal added. Noida: Ex-staffer claims call centre fra.description: NOIDA: A former call centre employee was allegedly assaulted and framed in a fake theft case by a sub-inspector after he resigned from the company in Noida suspecting fraud. Sahabuddin Siddiqui (26), who worked as an IT engineer since December 2018, submitted his resignation in March this year after he got to know that the “call centre cheats Americans on the pretext of fixing malware in their system due to hacking/virus, etc.” Sahabuddin said that after his resignation, the company on May 14 lodged a bogus FIR at Phase III police station, alleging data theft and that customers were receiving fake calls. “On May 19, the company owner asked me to come and collect my laptop. I failed to turn up as I was in Delhi for treatment at that time. Later, I went to the office on May 21 when a sub-inspector came there and started questioning me. Then he slapped me 14 times. This went on till 11 pm,” he said. CCTV footage of the incident shows SI Baljeet Singh slapping the victim. After the complainant wrote to the Gautam Budh Nagar SSP, IG (Meerut) and DIG on May 25, an inquiry was initiated. SSP Vaibhav Krishna said, “The SI in question is a dedicated officer. Action will be taken in case the allegations are found to be correct,” he said. Singh said the complainant had been found to be involved in data theft at the company. The complainant has approached the Allahabad high court for a stay on his arrest. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Noida: In multi-crore scam probe, a tuss.description: NOIDA: A black Mercedes parked at Sector 20 police station for the past two years has become a bone of contention between a company accused of multi-crore fraud through Ponzi schemes and the CBI. The car is owned by Webwork Trade Links Pvt Ltd, which has allegedly duped over 40,000 people of Rs 125 crore. The car is rusting at the police station since the two main accused — Anurag Garg and Sandesh Verma, who served as directors in Webwork Trade Links — were arrested in February 2017. Garg has now moved a Ghaziabad court, demanding that the car be released from the custody of CBI. Garg and Verma are out on bail. In his application to the special judicial magistrate, Ghaziabad, on April 22, Garg has claimed the car (UK07BX8000) was seized by GB Nagar police in the case lodged at the Sector 20 police station against the two directors. “Since the CBI is probing the case as per the directions of the Allahabad high court, the CBI has kept the car in its custody. The car is getting damaged due to being parked at the police station and its fitness is getting affected,” reads the application. The accused has given an undertaking that he won’t make changes in the make-up of the car and not sell it to anyone. However, in its response, the anti-corruption branch of CBI, Ghaziabad, has urged the court that the application for the release of car be dismissed. The investigation officer of the case, KS Lohchab, has said that “Sandesh Verma is not cooperating with the probe” and he had not reported to CBI in compliance of the notices issued. “The authenticity of the authorisation filed by the applicant on behalf of accused Sandesh Verma is appearing to be suspicious. The car has been purchased by the accused directors of Webwork Trade Links Pvt Ltd by using the fund of the company... the car may not be allowed to be released till completion of investigation,” reads the CBI response. The CBI has also filed an application for Verma’s bail cancellation at Allahabad HC. The next date of hearing in the case is July 24. When contacted, a spokesperson for CBI said the case is currently under investigation. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Greater Noida: Man abandons wife, leaves.description: GREATER NOIDA: A 25-year-old man left behind his wife and two children at his in-laws’ place and walked out with his 13-year-old sister-in-law, purportedly to marry her. The man, along with two uncles and a friend, has been booked for confining the minor girl. The woman’s father Hanif, a resident of Greater Noida, had filed a police complaint claiming that his son-in-law Allah Mehar had come over for Eid on June 7. “I was leaving for work when my son-in-law came with my daughter, two grandchildren and three of his relatives. When I came back from my shift, my daughter told me he had taken her younger sister along with him,” said Hanif, adding that the accused also took away Rs 70,000 in cash and jewellery kept in the house. Hanif said the next day, he went to Mehar’s house in Bulandshahr and requested him to free his younger daughter. “I requested him to let my daughter go because she is a minor and should not be forced into marriage. But he threatened me that he would get my family killed if I ever came back to see my daughter. He has been keeping her hostage for the past 10 days. I have sought police’s support,” said Hanif. Officers at Greater Noida police station registered an FIR on Sunday against Mehar (25), his uncles Tarikhat (30) and Bhoora (25), along with Nanhe (25), all residents of Bulandshahr, under sections 363 (kidnapping), 366 (abducting or inducing woman to compel her marriage), 506 (criminal intimidation) of the IPC. “The accused is absconding with the minor girl. We have reprimanded his relatives, arrests will be made soon,” said Sujeet Upadhyay, the SHO of Greater Noida police station. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Training to grow trees for livelihood.description: NOIDA: The forest department will start training villagers who own land to plant and maintain trees like eucalyptus, poplar and some varieties of phicus, which they can sell for timber after the trees have matured. Officials said this would not only generate a source of income for villagers, but also expand green cover in the district. As of now, the project has been planned for 88 villages. The officials said there was a growing demand for timber because of an expanding realty market and allowing it to be grown legally was the best way to meet the requirement. The trees that they are being encouraged to plant take almost 10 years to mature and their wood fetches good returns. “We are starting a series of informative and interactive sessions in villages of the district where we will inform villagers how to put their vacant land to use and grow trees as a mode of investment. People do not need permission of the forest department to cut some varieties of trees such as phicus, poplar and eucalyptus. We want the villagers to increasingly start growing these trees on their spare land. This will not only add to the green cover of the district, but will also become a source of income after 10 to 15 years,” forest officer PK Srivastava said. Teams from the forest department will visit cluster of villages soon to train the people. “We will provide all support to villagers once they agree to plant these trees. The forest department can also help with the saplings,” Srivastava said. “There is growing demand for timber in the market as houses are being built. So, if people grow these trees, they would surely be able to make money from them,” he added. The first round of interactive sessions with the villagers will start this week. The forest department will also conduct a district-wide plantation drive during the monsoon months of July and August. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Greater Noida: Child on worker\u2019s ba.description: GREATER NOIDA: A three-year-old girl tied to her mother’s back died while her parents were injured when the walls of a ditch that was being dug at a construction site collapsed on them in Greater Noida on Tuesday. Workers at the site said the two private contractors overseeing the construction had forced them to get into the ditch despite the soil being loose. Angoori (24), a construction worker, took along her three-year-old child, Monika, with her into the ditch as there was no one to look after her. Angoori, her husband Guddu (25) and Monika were all trapped under the soil along with two other labourers — Babulal (35) and Bari (55). The cave-in took place at the construction site of a private building in Knowledge Park area around 11.45am. An excavator had just dug a ditch to lay the foundation for the building when the two contractors — Lalit and Kapil Bhadana — asked six of their workers to get inside the 6ft ditch and level the walls manually. As both Angoori and Guddu were ordered to get inside, they could not have left Monika alone. “Minutes before the accident, an earthmover had dug up the area. After this, the contractors asked a bunch of workers to get inside the ditch and level the walls. This seemed risky, but the contractors forced the workers,” said Rajkumar, Angoori’s brother. He said the workers had told the two contractors that the soil was loose, but they refused to budge. “There was a pile of debris that needed to be excavated, but the contractor, without realising the odds, forced the workers inside the ditch. The walls collapsed within minutes and fell on the workers. The adults survived, but Monika succumbed to her injuries. My sister and brother-in-law, too, suffered injuries in the head and chest,” Rajkumar added. The victims were rushed to Sharda Hospital, where the child was declared dead on arrival, while others were admitted for treatment of injuries. The two contractors have been booked under sections 304A (causing death by negligence) on a complaint by Rajkumar. “The contractors — Lalit and Kapil Bhadana — fled the spot soon after the accident. Prima facie, the construction workers were not given any helmets before they were sent inside the drain. A probe has been initiated, and due action will be taken against those found guilty,” said Arvind Pathak, the station house officer of Knowledge Park police station. Asked about the condition of the other workers, the officer said one of them, Bari, was being treated for critical injuries. “Most of them have been discharged after first-aid. A woman named Bari is still in the ICU for critical head injuries,” Pathak added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

TV journalists held over Yogi Adityanath.description: GREATER NOIDA: Three staffers of a Noida-based news channel got bail on Wednesday, nearly a couple of weeks after their arrest in the wake of the channel airing a show that was deemed defamatory to the chief minister. But Ishika Singh, Anuj Shukla and Anshul Kaushik won’t walk out of jail yet because they have been booked in two FIRs, only one of which the court has ruled on. The court of additional district and sessions judge Nalin Kant Tyagi on Wednesday heard arguments in the defamation case filed by police against the trio for the show on the CM. The judge granted bail after submission of two sureties of Rs 40,000 each. The other case, which relates to charges of forgery and cheating and was registered because Nation Live, the channel, was allegedly found not to have the requisite permits, was heard by fast track court judge Ved Prakash Verma. The order has been reserved. The court asked the three news channel staffers not to seek a postponement of hearing during statements of witnesses and ensure presence either in person or through their lawyers on the dates of hearing. According to Nitin Gupta and Parth Upadhayay, lawyers for Shukla and Kaushik, respectively, they argued in court there was nothing defamatory in the TV discussion that was aired on June 6 and the channel had, in fact, tried to expose a woman who has been making controversial claims about the CM and also whether she was part of any political conspiracy. The woman featured on the programme through a dial-in. “We contended before the court that while the FIR states that the channel’s show was solely aimed at provoking members of a party, there were no riots even after two days of the discussion being aired as against what the police report anticipated. No complaint was lodged by any of the party members and despite allegations of defamation, the CM did not lodge an FIR but it was a policeman who did so,” Gupta said, adding they had also apprised the judge that the arrested trio was not produced before a court even 48 hours after their detention. The arrests took place after the local administration put together a report that saw the possibility of a law and order problem as a result of the show being aired. The office of Nation Live in Sector 63 was sealed on the same weekend as the arrests of Shukla and Ishika (June 8/9). Kaushik was arrested the following week. The FIR relating to defamation was filed on the complaint of a sub-inspector. The other was based on an inquiry by the district information department’s assistant director, Meena Biswas. The government counsel opposed bail, stating that the channel had aired a discussion on the CM, who is at a level where “even a small aspersion can spoil the situation of society”, and that it was a “crime serious in nature”. But the court said the discussion did not seem to cause enmity, hatred and disaffection in society. “The accused are in jail since June 9 (Ishika and Anuj) and June 11 (Anshul). Looking at the facts, there are sufficient grounds to grant bail without commenting on the merits/demerits of the case,” reads the court order. The court noted that the lawyers had contended that the trio had been “framed” and “they had no ill-intention in airing the discussion”. It also said the accused “do not have any criminal past”. Rs 5 lakh ransom sought for student.description: GHAZIABAD: The father of a 20-year-old B Pharm student has filed a complaint of the abduction of his son. The complainant told police that following the kidnap on Wednesday, he received a ransom call from a gangster who demanded Rs 5 lakh for safely returning his son. Police said the student was kidnapped when he had gone to his college to get some changes done in his marksheet. An FIR has been registered against the unknown kidnappers under IPC sections 364 A (kidnapping for ransom), 323 (causing hurt) and 506 (criminal intimidation) at Kavi Nagar police station. “This is a serious case and we are investigating it from all angles,” said Shlok Kumar, SP (city).
